title: Single-page Valentine prompt with evasive No and Yes success meme

requirements.summary: Implement a single-page Valentine prompt with an English question and two buttons labeled exactly “Yes” and “No”.
acceptanceCriteria: The page displays a clear question asking the user to be the Valentine.
Two buttons are present and labeled exactly “Yes” and “No”.
All visible text is in English.

file_operations.description: Create the single-page React view that renders the Valentine question and two buttons labeled exactly “Yes” and “No”, using English-only user-facing text. If using shadcn-ui for the buttons/layout, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Extract the prompt UI (question + Yes/No choices) into a dedicated component used by App to keep the single-page structure clean. If using shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button/Card) for consistent styling, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Verify the app renders the newly created App component without additional navigation/pages; keep the experience single-page as required (no new routes).

requirements.summary: Add evasive behavior to the “No” button on hover and touch/pointer interactions, keeping it on-screen and not permanently overlapping “Yes”.
acceptanceCriteria: Hovering over the “No” button causes it to move away before a click can be completed.
On iPad/Chrome, the “No” button also evades touch interactions (e.g., on touchstart/pointerdown) in a comparable way.
The “No” button remains visible (does not end up off-screen) and does not overlap the “Yes” button permanently.

file_operations.description: Implement a reusable hook that computes safe random positions for the “No” button within a container/viewport, clamps to bounds so it stays visible, and avoids persistent overlap with the “Yes” button region; support pointer events for iPad (pointerenter/pointerdown/touchstart equivalents).

Wire the evasive logic to the “No” button (hover + pointer/touch interactions) and render the “No” button using positioning that allows movement within a bounded container while remaining responsive. If using shadcn-ui Button, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure the prompt container establishes a reliable positioning context (e.g., relative container) for evasive movement and that the “Yes” button remains consistently tappable/visible while the “No” button moves.

requirements.summary: On “Yes” click, transition to a success state showing the meme image and the exact caption “Good choice”, with “No” no longer actionable.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Yes” reliably replaces or overlays the initial prompt with a success view.
The success view displays the meme image and the exact text “Good choice”.
After clicking “Yes”, the “No” option is no longer presented as an actionable choice (e.g., hidden/disabled/removed).

file_operations.description: Create a success-state component that displays the meme image and the exact caption text “Good choice”. If using shadcn-ui Card/Typography utilities for polished presentation, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add UI state to switch between the initial prompt and the success view on “Yes” click; ensure the “No” button is not rendered (or otherwise not actionable) after success.

requirements.summary: Apply a romantic pink-and-white theme with a polished, responsive, touch-friendly layout for iPad Chrome.
acceptanceCriteria: Primary palette is pink and white; the UI reads clearly with sufficient contrast.
Layout adapts to common iPad viewport sizes without overflowing or requiring horizontal scrolling.
Buttons are large enough to tap comfortably on a touchscreen.

file_operations.description: Add Tailwind base/styles and define global CSS variables/theme tokens to achieve a pink-and-white romantic palette with readable contrast; keep typography responsive and touch-friendly sizing.

Apply responsive layout and spacing (single-page centered card/layout, readable type scale, large tap targets) suitable for iPad Chrome, staying within the pink/white theme. If using shadcn-ui layout primitives, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Establish and consistently apply a cohesive creative direction (romantic card/scrapbook aesthetic) without adding extra features beyond the required interactions.
acceptanceCriteria: The page uses a single coherent style (typography, borders/shadows, background accents) that feels intentionally designed.
No extra features are introduced beyond the Valentine question, Yes/No interaction, and the Yes success/meme state.

file_operations.description: Refine the prompt styling to match a consistent romantic card/scrapbook aesthetic (cohesive typography, borders/shadows, subtle decorative accents) without introducing additional features or interactions beyond Yes/No and evasive No behavior.
Match the success view styling to the same cohesive aesthetic (consistent spacing/typography/decorative elements) while keeping the feature set limited to the meme + “Good choice” caption.
Add/adjust any global theme tokens needed to keep the aesthetic consistent across both states (prompt and success) while maintaining readability and responsiveness.

requirements.summary: Add the required generated meme image as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and render it directly in the success view.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated image files exist under frontend/public/assets/generated with the specified filenames.
The “Yes” success state loads the meme image from the static assets path and displays it correctly in the UI.

file_operations.description: Add the generated static image asset file at the exact path: frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1200x800.png.
Render the success meme image by referencing the static asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1200x800.png and display the exact caption text “Good choice”.
